definition: land used for growing plants/site used for public recreation/abbr. for a place ending in 園|园, such as a botanical garden 植物園|植物园, kindergarten 幼兒園|幼儿园 etc
woods/forest/CL:片[pian4]/circle(s) (i.e. specific group of people)/a collection (of similar things)

sentences.english: With special renovation, Beijing will again take on the scene it once had, complete with its historical rivers and classical gardens.

sentences.english: Gardens in Japan, though of Chinese parentage, have more conventions and less complexity in lay-out than the Chinese.

sentences.english: Chinese gardens can be divided into two categories,  the imperial and the private.
